messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] websites
messages.msgSnippet: ... I made a surprisingly lengthy list of all the things that my dd and I like to do under several headings and keep a copy on the fridge door. I have it
messages.messageBody:
<<<< find it hard to come up
> with something different when we are bored. >>>

I made a surprisingly lengthy list of all the things that my dd and I like
to do under several headings and keep a copy on the fridge door. I have it
divided into sections - Outings, At Home, Quiet things, Games, Arts and
Crafts, and Physical. It is helpful especially when I am tired.

Jayn's current favorite gaming websites are Webkinz and EverythingGirl.com.

Robyn L. Coburn

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] websites
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Anyway. I was hoping to get some recomendations for websites where I can find fun activities for us to do.-=- Instead of looking for schoolish websites with
messages.messageBody:
-=-Anyway. I was hoping to get some recomendations for websites where I
can find fun activities for us to do.-=-



Instead of looking for schoolish websites with projects and
instructions, I recommend you look at unschooling websites and see
what other families have done.

Some of the websites below DO have museum-section type things, and
online games:

http://sandradodd.com/typical (typical days of several different
families)

http://sandradodd.com/history

http://sandradodd.com/art

http://sandradodd.com/music



Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: websites
messages.msgSnippet: Hello all! I don t think I have done an intro here. I m Courtney and am unschooling along side my awesome son John, 7. Anyway. I was hoping to get some
messages.messageBody:
Hello all!
I don't think I have done an intro here. I'm Courtney and am
unschooling along side my awesome son John, 7.
Anyway. I was hoping to get some recomendations for websites where I
can find fun activities for us to do. I am not very creative naturally
(maybe due to my 20+ yrs of schooling :) and find it hard to come up
with something different when we are bored. The sites could be arts &
craftsy, games, ects. Thanks in advance!
Courtney
